name: Introduction to Humanities
description: This course provides an overview of the humanities, with a focus on literature, philosophy, art, music, and architecture.

name: Introduction to Political Science
description: This course provides an overview of the field of political science, introducing students to the basic concepts, theories, and methods of the discipline.

name: Political Theory
description: This course explores the history of political thought from ancient to modern times, focusing on the writings of major political thinkers.

name: International Relations
description: This course examines the forces that create and maintain relations among nations, including diplomacy, international law, and theories of international politics.

name: Comparative Politics
description: This course examines the politics, economics, and social structures of various countries, exploring the similarities and differences between them.
